draw.controller.handler

Class Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • draw.controller.handler.Handler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IActionInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChangeCursorHandler, CreateHandler, ResizeHandler, SelectHandler

    public abstract class Handler
extends java.lang.Object
implements IActionInterface
    Handler for Chain of Responsibilities. This class provides a default terminal implementation, that is, invocations on any of the methods in IActionInterface are ignored, and false is returned.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface draw.controller.IActionInterface

      • isInterested

        public boolean isInterested()
        Uses currently selected action to determine if this handler is interested in processing events. Each handler subclass overrides the interested(Action) method to declare actions of interest.
        Returns:
        whether a given handler is interested in processing events

      • setNext

        public Handler setNext(Handler next)
        Add next to be the next in the chain. In draw.2, fixed to return next instead of self to chain properly.
        Parameters:
        next - Next handler to append
        Returns:
        next, so programmer can chain together

      • move

        public boolean move(java.awt.Point pt,
                    int modifiers,
                    java.util.Optional<Element> elt,
                    int anchor)
        Description copied from interface: IActionInterface
        Movement of cursor detected without the mouse button being pressed.

        Element is the optional element over which the point is moving. If it is present then there are two options:

        1. anchor is one of these values, as it passes over the anchor area.
          • Cursor.NW_RESIZE_CURSOR (6)
          • Cursor.NE_RESIZE_CURSOR (7)
          • Cursor.SE_RESIZE_CURSOR (5)
          • Cursor.SW_RESIZE_CURSOR (4)
        2. anchor is zero (0 or NoAnchor) which means it points over an element.

        When element is not present, then cursor is moving over some place in which no element intersects.

        In all cases, modifiers reflects whether shift or control is down.

        Specified by:
        move in interface IActionInterface
        Parameters:
        pt - mouse location
        modifiers - keyboard modifiers in effect
        elt - optional element in play
        anchor - which anchor is affected
        Returns:
        whether mouse action was processed
